channel.title: Best 3D program and info for making a game?
channel.description:
Well, i wanted to see if I could make a little 3D game kinda like WoW in a way, but 1 million times more basic and stuff.
Currently I have milkshape 3d and am learning a little C++ but I still have no real idea how to do the rest.
What is the best 3D modeling program that i should use and is it C# or C++ i should know?
Any other info would be great also lol.

item.title: Best 3D program and info for making a game?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

Learn C# and get XNA…good for beginners. After that you might want to move onto C.

Read full topic

item.title: Best 3D program and info for making a game?
item.dc:creator: @Project_69 Project 69
item.description:
@Project_69 wrote:

I would choose Borland or Cygwin for compilers if you are on a windows system, maybe Dev-C++. Or if you are on a Linux system, use the compiler in it, if it has.

Direct link to GameDevs C/C++ tuts.

These links may be of interest to you, they deal with 3ds Max:

Character Rigging Online Information

CGTalk - Autodesk 3ds Max

Read full topic
item.source: Best 3D program and info for making a game?

item.title: Best 3D program and info for making a game?
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Well, i got the full version of Autodesk 3ds Max 9 and it seems good so far, just gotta read some tuts.

And for C++, should I use Microsoft Visual C++ or Dev-C++ lol.

Thanks a lot for the help ppl btw.

Read full topic
item.source: Best 3D program and info for making a game?

item.title: Best 3D program and info for making a game?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I was a maya user, look into it if you want. I prefered it far more then any other program.

The easiest to learn, but probably the least powerful, is wings3d. Google it.

[quote=“Rune Hacker, post:8, topic:139937”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=192054.msg1729503#msg1729503 date=1188853518]
[/quote]
Maya - Looks neat but what exactly does this do that other’s don’t have?[/quote]

Maya was designed for higher end animation. For a full character animation, you can get much better results with Maya. Really it’s just a matter of preference though.

Rune Hacker:

How was WoW made then, DirectX, Torgue X game engine, what?

Lol WoW definitly wasn’t made with Torque. They would have made their own engine from scratch most likely.

Read full topic

item.title: Best 3D program and info for making a game?
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

maya is by far the best. extremely expensive, and I’ve yet to see a torrent of it. But c++ is the best. My suggestion to you, is to start out making basic shit, like a little 3d calculator, or a sweet ass 3d solitare game.

item.source: Best 3D program and info for making a game?

item.title: Best 3D program and info for making a game?
item.dc:creator: @Project_69 Project 69
item.description:
@Project_69 wrote:

Well, sorry to say it, but Milkshape 3d ain’t good for almost anything besides exporting The Sims 2 meshes.

You should try 3ds Max or something like that (Max was used by Blizzard to make WoW).

As for C# or C++, I would have chosen C++, but it’s really nearly a choice of what you like. If you are going to use DirectX, I suggest you use C++. But again, it’s up to you to decide.

A link of interest for you would be GameDev’s Articles and Resources. The articles there would possibly help you a great deal.

Read full topic
item.source: Best 3D program and info for making a game?
